content:
本件保存
會員 委 設建 庫 水 門 石
SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
SDC - 5111
May 12, 1962
年
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Excess Equipment Project No. 84-99-471
Dear Mr. Johnson:
Reference is made to the copy of the letter from The J. G. White Engineering Corporation addressed to Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief of Second Division, CUSA dated April 25, 1962 on the above subject.
It is recommended by MKA that the Roller Road, Austin-Western, 10 ton, each 1, as mentioned under Shipment No. 216 in the above letter is required by the Shihmen Project.
140.112.213.82
We, therefore, request your arrangement to allocate this roller to Shihmen Project.
Your action on this matter will be appreciated.
Very truly yours, SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
Y
W.11. 1h
2 2
W. K. Ku Chief Engineer
51.5. 15
+
09589 V.O.
Cc: Mr. J. B. Carter, AID/M
S G. Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA
(2) TCC/mw
运
OUSA 5
國史饭 Academia Historica
394

paragraphs.content: 會員 委 設建 庫 水 門 石
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary-General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Reference is made to the copy of the letter from The J. G. White Engineering Corporation addressed to Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief of Second Division, CUSA dated April 25, 1962 on the above subject.
It is recommended by MKA that the Roller Road, Austin-Western, 10 ton, each 1, as mentioned under Shipment No. 216 in the above letter is required by the Shihmen Project.
We, therefore, request your arrangement to allocate this roller to Shihmen Project.
Your action on this matter will be appreciated.
Very truly yours, SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
Cc: Mr. J. B. Carter, AID/M
S G. Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA
